meanings.definition: To load or put a load on or in.
meanings.sent1: She lades the groceries into the car.
meanings.sent2: He lades the bricks onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: The ants lades the food into their tiny home.
meanings.sent4: The sun lades the sky with colors at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The workers lades the boxes with care to avoid breakage.

meanings.definition: To put a burden or charge on or in.
meanings.sent1: The teacher lades the students with homework.
meanings.sent2: The boss lades him with responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The clouds lades the sky with raindrops.
meanings.sent4: Her words lades his heart with sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The backpack lades her shoulders as she hikes up the hill.

meanings.definition: To transfer (liquid) from one container to another.
meanings.sent1: She lades the water from the pitcher into the glass.
meanings.sent2: He lades the soup from the pot into the bowl.
meanings.sent3: The river lades the valley with its flowing waters.
meanings.sent4: The wind lades the air with the scent of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The bartender lades the drink into the glass with precision.
